./.title: Introduction
./.body: Elegant Web Front End HTML / CSS / JavaScript Elegant Web Front End documentation is built using GitBook. Global installation GitBook Please install nodejs and npm before continuing installation. npm install -g gitbook-cli Clone git clone https://github.com/MiGongOrg/Elegant-Web-Front-End.git Install cd Elegant-Web-Front-End gitbook init gitbook install ./ Build gitbook build Preview gitbook serve http://localhost:4000 Language book.json { "language": "zh-hans" } en, ar, bn, cs, de, en, es, fa, fi, fr, he, it, ja, ko, no, pl, pt, ro, ru, sv, uk, vi, zh-hans, zh-tw

css/base.html.title: Base
css/base.html.body: Base Keyframe Before @keyframes down { 0% { top: 0; } 100% { top: 100%; } } After @keyframes down { from { top: 0; } to { top: 100%; } } Other @keyframes down { to { top: 100%; } } Alternate Before .animation { animation-name: down; animation-duration: 5s; animation-timing-function: linear; animation-iteration-count: infinite; animation-direction: alternate; } @keyframes down { 0% { top: 0; } 100% { top: 100%; } } After .animation { animation: down 5s linear infinite alternate; } @keyframes down { to { top: 100%; } } Other .animation { animation: down 5s linear infinite; } @keyframes down { 50% { top: 100%; } } Spacing Before li { margin-top: 20px; } li:first-child { margin-top: 0; } After li:not(:first-child) { margin-top: 20px; } Other ul * + * { margin-top: 20px; }

javascript/base.html.title: Base
javascript/base.html.body: Base Variable var let const Before var apple = 0; var banana = 1; var orange = 2; After var apple = 0, banana = 1, orange = 2; Other var apple = 0 , banana = 1 , orange = 2; Value Before counter = counter + 1; After counter += 1; Other counter++; Function ES 5 VS ES 6 return sum Before var sum = function (x) { return x + x; }; console.log(sum(2)); // 4 After This is ES 6 code, you can also see the ES 5 output ES 6ES 5let sum = (x) => { x + x } console.log(sum(2)); // 4"use strict"; var sum = function sum(x) { x + x; }; console.log(sum(2)); // 4 Other This is ES 6 code, you can also see the ES 5 output ES 6ES 5let sum = x => x + x console.log(sum(2)); // 4"use strict"; var sum = function sum(x) { return x + x; }; console.log(sum(2)); // 4 Array loops Before var array = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; for (var i = 0; i After var array = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; array.forEach(function (item) { console.log(item); // 0 1 2 3 4 5 }); Other This is ES 6 code, you can also see the ES 5 output ES 6ES 5let array = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; array.forEach(item => console.log(item)); // 0 1 2 3 4 5"use strict"; var array = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; array.forEach(function (item) { return console.log(item); }); // 0 1 2 3 4 5
